title: Domain 2.5: Explain the purpose of mitigation techniques used to secure the enterprise.
content:
🧱 Segmentation

Divides networks into smaller zones to contain threats—limits lateral movement of attackers.

🔐 Access Control

  • Access Control List (ACL): Rules that define who or what can access certain resources.
  • Permissions: Set specific actions users can perform (read, write, execute).

✅ Application Allow List

Only approved apps are allowed to run, blocking unauthorized or unknown software.

🚧 Isolation

Keeps systems or networks separate to minimize exposure and limit compromise spread.

🔧 Patching

Regular software updates that fix security flaws and enhance system protection.

🔐 Encryption

Protects data during transmission and while stored—requires decryption key to access.

👁️ Monitoring

Constant tracking of systems for unusual activity—helps detect threats early.

🧍 Least Privilege

Grants users/systems only the access they absolutely need to operate.

⚙️ Configuration Enforcement

Makes sure all systems follow consistent, secure setup standards—prevents misconfigurations.

🗑️ Decommissioning

Securely retiring systems—includes data wiping, hardware disposal, and access revocation.

🛡️ Hardening Techniques

  • Encryption: Safeguards sensitive data.
  • Installation of Endpoint Protection: Antivirus/anti-malware to detect local threats.
  • Host-based Firewall: Controls device-specific network traffic.
  • Host-based Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS): Blocks threats in real time.
  • Disabling Ports/Protocols: Shuts down unneeded features to reduce risk.
  • Default Password Changes: Avoids easy-to-guess logins.
  • Removal of Unnecessary Software: Shrinks attack surface by removing unused programs.
